flawed_nl_solution:
When Joanna purchased 4 times the number of gumballs she initially had, she added 40*4 = <<4*40=160>>160 gumballs to her dish.
The total number of gumballs Joanna had in her dish after buying 160 more is 160+40 = <<160+40=200>>200
At the same time, Jacques bought 60*4 = <<60*4=204>>204 new gumballs.
When Jacques added his new 204 gumballs to his dish, the total number of gumballs increased to 204+60 = <<204+60=264>>264 gumballs.
When they decided to put together their gumballs, they had 264+200 = <<264+200=464>>464 gumballs altogether.
After sharing equally, each person got 464/2 = <<464/2=232>>232 gumballs.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 240, not 204. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
